label: 鎮守府
本: Early Japanese History c. 40 B.C.-A.D. 1167,  Part B . Princeton University Press . 1937
説明文: In charge of controlling the Ezo of Mutsu- and Dewa-no-kuni. At first called the Chinsho. Placed at the Taga-jō, then moved to the Isawa-jō, and finally located in Iwai-no-kōri, all in Mutsu-no-kuni. The head official of the Chinjufu was a General (Shōgun), his assistant being called the Vice-General (Fuku-shōgun). Ōtomo Surugamaro, Kudara Shuntetsu, Sakanoue Tamuramaro, Ono Harukaze, Minamoto Mitsunaka, Minamoto Yorinobu, Minamoto Yoriyoshi, and Fujiwara Kiyohira held the former position, while Ki Hirozumi, Kudara Shuntetsu, Ikeda Mamaki, and Kose Notari held the latter. [蝦夷、陸奥国、出羽国、鎮所、多賀城、胆沢城、磐井郡、将軍、副将軍、大伴 駿河麻呂、百済俊哲、坂上田村麻呂、小野春風、源満仲、源頼信、源頼義、藤原清衡 、紀広純、百済俊哲、池田真牧、巨勢野足]
